page.title: 08LLANSTEFFAN AREA: FARMING 2.
page.content: All the larger dairy farms milk in a parlour and smaller ones still milk in the traditional cowshed. 90 per cent milk into a pipeline which transfers the milk to a bulk collecting tank for cooling. Tankers collect daily, taking the milk to the Milk Marketing Board creamery at Carmarthen for cheese manufacture. Producer retailers supply milk to each village. If snow makes farms inaccessible, farmers transport milk in emergency tanks to central collection points. Dairy cattle are all either Fresian or Holstein. Most dairy farms rear replacements mainly using artificial insemination. Many also keep a beef bull, Hereford or Charollais or their crossbreeds. All dairy cattle are winterhoused in cubicles or cowsheds. Grass silage and hay are basic winter feed, with only 4 farms growing barley for livestock fee
